posts.post_content:
@Gogo: "Outside the game" is your sideboard in tournaments or any card in your collection in casual that's not in the game. Exiled is an in-game zone. They changed the name of that zone from "Removed from the game" to try to clear up the confusion. But it really didn't work, I've seen a lot of people asking this same question.
  
   
See also: the rulings on any wish card ([Burning Wish](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burning Wish), etc.)
posts.html:
@Gogo: "Outside the game" is your sideboard in tournaments or any card in your collection in casual that's not in the game. Exiled is an in-game zone. They changed the name of that zone from "Removed from the game" to try to clear up the confusion. But it really didn't work, I've seen a lot of people asking this same question.

See also: the rulings on any wish card (Burning Wish, etc.)

posts.post_content:
@donovan\_fabian  
STFU. This card is awesome.  
You can make eldrazi spawn every turn, and he's a 7/11 for 10 with annihilator 1. The 20 mana ability is nearly pointless, and will just make retards like you misunderstand the point of the card, and that point is that you can make eldrazi spawn **EVERY SINGLE TURN**. Including your opponents. Blockers...  
  
Also, you can only cast the eldrazi if their in your sideboard, not if you have a colection.  
  
Also, it says "cast" in the descrip tion, so yes, you will indeed take 2 turns if you use the ablility on   
[Emrakul, the Aeons Torn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul, the Aeons Torn), as will you get a free [vindicate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=vindicate), and draw four cards with [Ulamog, the Infninte Gyre](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ulamog, the Infninte Gyre) and [Kozilek, Butcher of Truth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kozilek, Butcher of Truth).  
  
And if you actually consider using his final ability (which is not what makes this card good), definitely put all is dust in your sideboard; it wipes the field for your eldrazi coming into play.   
  
Also, the effect says... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Here's a sideboard suggestion someone gave me: 4 Emrakul, 4 Ulamog, 1 Kozilek, 1 All Is Dust, whatever else. The Emrakuls and Ulamogs will all die, but you still get four more turns and just shot four permanents into oblivion, and Kozilek will have four turns of swinging on an open field before your opponent can do much.
  
   
Also, this card has provoked me to keep my common and uncommon Eldrazi in a page in the back of my binder. Because I love me some casual.

posts.post_content:
This + [Training Grounds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Training Grounds) = infinite "when another creature comes into play" effects or "when another creature goes to the graveyard" effects  
  
[Soul Warden](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Warden) or [Deathgreeter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathgreeter) = infinite life  
[Rockslide Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rockslide Elemental) or [Scavenger Drake](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scavenger Drake) or [Algae Gharial](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Algae Gharial) = infinite power/toughness
posts.html:
This + Training Grounds = infinite "when another creature comes into play" effects or "when another creature goes to the graveyard" effects

Soul Warden or Deathgreeter = infinite life
Rockslide Elemental or Scavenger Drake or Algae Gharial = infinite power/toughness

Posted By: Guntz1092 (6/25/2010 4:53:52 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Yep, they're both 7/11.  
  
Anyway, I'm building a deck around this guy, for its {20} ability (Yeah, seriously). 12 Cards in my sideboard for usual sideboarding, and the other three are an [Emrakul, the Aeons Torn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul, the Aeons Torn), [It That Betrays](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=It That Betrays) and [All Is Dust](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=All Is Dust). Have It that Betrays resolve before All is Dust, and while you lose all your colored permanents, you *gain* your opponent's colored permanents. Then swing in an Emrakul, and you're even more tied for the win than ''just'' an Emrakul.
posts.html:
Yep, they're both 7/11.

Anyway, I'm building a deck around this guy, for its {20} ability (Yeah, seriously). 12 Cards in my sideboard for usual sideboarding, and the other three are an Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, It That Betrays and All Is Dust. Have It that Betrays resolve before All is Dust, and while you lose all your colored permanents, you gain your opponent's colored permanents. Posted By: HedgeIII (5/29/2010 8:21:27 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I'd let my opponent play the 20CC ability just so I could see the look on his face when I played [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God) next turn, hahaha. Hell, playing [Sleep](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sleep) and then killing him with a [Storm Crow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Storm Crow) might be an even better play.
  
   
In all seriousness, the power of this guy is obviously the token creation. You can either pull out blockers on the fly or create a huge mana ramp for end-game ridiculousness.
  
   
Not a game winner, unless you get to 20 mana, and then your probably going to win anyway.
  
   
4/5
posts.html:

In all seriousness, the power of this guy is obviously the token creation. You can either pull out blockers on the fly or create a huge mana ramp for end-game ridiculousness.

Not a game winner, unless you get to 20 mana, and then your probably going to win anyway.

4/5

posts.post_content: I love this card bec i can make infinate tokens for free, NO mana used. You must play this in order though. First the spawnsire, or a training grounds then the other. Lastly play an eye of ugin. The training grounds puts the ability to 2, and the eye takes it to 0 bec it doesn't have the restrictions that training grounds has, but the training grounds MUST be played before the eye or you still have to pay the 1 which still isn't bad. The other way to do it is with a mirror gallery out and 2 eye of ugins out.
